question: The Cardinal movements in sequence in labour are:-
exp: Cardinal movements in sequence in labour are - Head floating-Engagement-Descent- Flexion -->Internal rotation-Extension- External rotation- Anterior shoulder delivered- Posterior shoulder delivered
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: A primigravida is in second stage of labour since 1 hr. On examination the leading point of fetal skull is at +2 station and rotation is 450 sho. This can fuher be managed by
exp: The patient fulfills the criteria for applying low forceps The criteria for applying low forceps - (1) Leading point of fetal skull at station+ 2 cm and not on the pelvic floor, (2) Rotation is 45o or less. If the fetal head is at station below this or rotation doesn't exceed 45o, then one can apply outlet forceps. A: Unrotated head in transverse position B: 45 degree sho of complete rotation C: fully rotated head (ideal for application of forceps) In modern obstetrics there is no role of midcavity or high forceps, i. e. only station +2 and below are extracted with forceps (low and outlet forceps)
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Latent phase of Labour is said to be prolonged when the duration in a primigravida is more than...
exp: Latent phase in a Primigravida is prolonged if its more than 20 hours, multigravida if its more than 14 hours Labour Pattern Primigravida Multigravida Prolonged latent phase > 20hours >14 hr
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Which of the following is the presenting pa in the fetus in left occiputo - anterior (LOA) position:
exp: In Left occiput anterior (LOA) position, the head is flexed sharply so that the chin is in contact with the thorax. The occipital fontanelle is the presenting pa, and this presentation is referred to as a veex or occiput presentation. If Fetal head is - Well flexed - Veex presentation Deflexed head - Brow presentation Extended head - Face presentation
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Diagramatic representation shows which degree of perineal tear:
exp: First-degree tear: Laceration is limited to the fourchette and superficial perineal skin or vaginal mucosa Second-degree tear: Laceration extends to perineal muscles and fascia, but not the anal sphincter Third-degree tear: Anal sphincters are torn Third-degree tears - Three subcategories: 3a: paial tear of the external anal sphincter involving less than 50% thickness 3b: greater than 50% tear of the external anal sphincter 3c: internal sphincter is torn Fouh-degree tear: Rectal mucosa is torn First and Second degree tears are called Paial Perineal tears. Third and Fouh degree tears are called Complete Perineal tears.
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Occipito posterior position in labor, management is -
exp: Out of total Occipito posterior position, -80% becomes Occipito. Anterior- Mode of delivery - Normal (hence it is preferable to wait and watch for spontaneous rotation to occur) -15-16% becomes persistent Occipito. Posterior occurs in anthropoid pelvis Mode of delivery - Face to pubis delivery -2-4% undergoes Deep transverse arrest occurs in android pelvis Mode of delivery - Manual rotation and forceps extraction(sagittal suture of baby should be in AP plane of pelvis) or cesarean section
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: A term multigravida is in labour since 12 hours. O/E PR: 116/min, BP is 90/60, tongue is dry, uterine contractions of 45 sec felt every 3 mins, cervix is thick, 6-7 cm dilated, membranes are absent, fetal head is at station -2 with a caput till +3 station. Urine is blood stained. The most likely diagnosis is:-
exp: This is a case of obstructed labour since patient is in labour for a relatively long duration despite good contractions, there are signs of dehydration, excessive caput and blood stained urine due to prolonged compression of bladder OBSTRUCTED LABOR Obstructed labor is one in which inspite of good uterine contractions, the progressive descent of the presenting pa is obstructed due to mechanical obstruction Causes Cephalopelvic dispropoion Soft tissue obstruction Malpresentations and malpositions Big or malformed fetus Clinical features and complications Maternal exhaustion Dehydration Genital sepsis Caput succadeneum: accumulation of fluid anterior to girdle of contact Uterine rupture Fetal ashyxia, acidosis, intracranial hemorrhage, death PPH Hematuria: as base of bladder is compressed between pubic symphysis and presenting pa Shock Genitourinary fistula: delayed complication secondary to pressure necrosis
opa: Patient is in advance labour with expected findings
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Transverse diameter of the pelvic outlet is:
exp: Transverse diameter of the obstetrical outlet / inter-ischial tuberous diameter - 10. 5 cm An inter-ischial tuberous diameter of 8 cm or less is defined as a Contracted Outlet
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: A primigravida presents to casualty at 32 weeks gestation with acute pain abdomen for 2 hours, vaginal bleeding and decreased fetal movements. She should be managed by:
exp: The patient here is of Abruption( Accidental hemorrhage) in pregnancy. This is never managed conservatively and the best option is to give Steroids for pulmonary maturity and alongside sta the process of induction of labor. Decreased fetal movements is not an indication for cesarean section but to do more intensive ante paum fetal monitoring. An LSCS is only done if abruption has associated complications like fetal distress etc.
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Most common cause of occipito-posterior presentation:
exp: Occipito Posterior is a veex presentation with foetal back directed posteriorly. 10% at onset of labour. Occipito posterior may have association with anthropoid, most commonly, and android pelvis: The anthropoid pelvis is marked by an oval inlet (but the anteroposterior diameter exceeds the transverse), the pelvic side walls diverge, and the sacrum is inclined posteriorly. Its associated with Persistent occipito posterior presentation and Face to pubis delivery The android (male-like) pelvis, where the inlet is wedge shaped, the pelvic sidewalls are convergent, the ischial spines are prominent, the subpubic arch is narrow, and the sacrum is inclined anteriorly in its lower one third. It is likely to be associated with deep transverse arrest dystocia.
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Intrahepatic cholestatis liver disease of pregnancy, plan delivery at
exp: Management of Intrahepatic cholestatis of Pregnancy: 1. Ursodeoxycholic acid - increases excretion of bile acis. Also reduces neontal complications 2. Strict maternal and fetal surveillance 3. Termination of pregnancy - Definitive management. Done at 37 weeks after which fetal risk of morbidity and moality keeps on increasing
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Phase 3 of paurition is:
exp: Phases of Paurition Paurition, the bringing foh of young, encompasses all physiological processes involved in bihing: Phase 1 = Prelude to paurition Phase 2 (Activation) = Preparation for labor Phase 3 (Stimulation) =Processes of labor Phase 4 (Involution) =Paurient recovery The clinical stages of labor, which are the first, second, and third stages together make up phase 3 of paurition. Please note: The phases of paurition should not be confused with the clinical stages of labor
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Which forceps is used in after-coming head in breech delivery?
exp: Pipers forceps are without a pelvic curve and only the cephalic curve. These are used for the management of the delivery of 'After coming head' in breech vaginal delivery.
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Pain in early labour is limited to dermatomes-
exp: Labor pain caused by uterine contractions and cervical dilation is transmitted through visceral afferent sympathetic nerves entering the spinal cord from T10 - L1. Later in labor, perineal stretching transmits painful stimuli through the pudendal nerve and sacral nerves S2 - S4.
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Engagement of fetal head is:
exp: Engagement - The mechanism by which the widest diameter of he presenting pa such as the biparietal diameter in an occiput presentation--passes through the pelvic inlet. Deflexed head is the most common cause of non engagement, which indicates towards caeseran section
opa: When the occiput has gone below the pelvic inlet
opb: When the widest diameter of the presenting pa has passed through the pelvic inlet
opc: When the presenting pa can be pushed into the pelvic cavity
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Most common risk factor for breech presentation is:
exp: Risk factors for Breech presentation - Prematurity (Most common Risk factor) Increased amniotic fluid volume Multifetal gestation Hydrocephaly Anencephaly Uterine anomalies Placenta pre Fundal placental implantation Pelvic tumors High parity with uterine relaxation Prior breech delivery
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: A 34 weeks pregnant woman with complaints of leaking vaginal discharge. What examination will confirm premature rupture of membranes in this patient?
exp: On per speculum examination - a gush of fluid is an obvious diagnostic test for PROM. If the leak is small or not significant, it may not be possible to visualise it. Some investigations which are known to help are - Nitrazine paper test Fern Test Indigocarmine dye test
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: On per vaginal examination, anterior fontanelle and supra-orbital ridge is felt in the second stage of labor. The presentation is:
exp: BROW PRESENTATION The diameter of engagement is Mento. Veical which is 14 cms Occurs in a deflexed head Supraorbital ridges and anterior fontanelle is palpable Occiput is higher than sinciput No mechanism of labour as a mentoveical diameter. Delivery is by cesarean section
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Most common type of breech presentation at term is:-
exp: Frank breech is the most common type of breech frank breech presentation- the lower extremities are flexed at the hips and extended at the knees, and thus the feet lie in close proximity to the head.
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Internal podalic version(IPV) is indicated in:
exp: Internal podalic version(IPV) is not done in transverse lie in singleton pregnancy due to risk of uterine rupture It can be done in transverse lie of 2nd baby in twin pregnancy as uterus will be relaxed for some time after delivery of first twin and chances of rupture are reduced.
opb: advanced labour in Brow presentation & conve to face
opd: Transverse lie in second of twins
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management

question: Average duration of 3rd stage of labor is:
exp: Stage Definition- First: From the onset of TRUE labor to full dilation of cervix. Average duration: 12 hours in primigravida and 6 hours in multigravida. Second: From full dilation of cervix to bih of the baby. Median duration is approximately 50 minutes in primigravida and 20 minutes in multigravida. Third: From bih of the baby to delivery of the placenta. Average duration: 15 minutes in both primigravida and multigravida. Fouh: 1-hour observation period, following delivery of the placenta.
topic_name: Labour - normal, abnormal, malposition, malpresentation and their management
